source_sentence: 金光明最勝王經卷第六
translation: Jin guangming zuishengwang jing, vol. 6

source_sentence: 大唐三藏沙門義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translation by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijing of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 四天王護國品第十二
translation: The Twelfth Chapter of the Four Heavenly Kings Who Protect Their Countries

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊聞四天王恭敬供養《金光明經》，及能擁護諸持經者，讚言：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān heard that the four heavenly kings were respectfully making offerings to the Sutra of Golden Light and were able to support the bearers of the sūtra, and he praised them, saying, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝等四王已於過去無量百千萬億佛所，恭敬供養，尊重讚歎，植諸善根，修行正法，常說正法，以法化世。
translation: You four kings have paid respect to and offered support to measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of buddhas in the past, honored and praised them, planted good roots, cultivated the right teaching, always taught the right teaching, and transformed the world with the teaching.

source_sentence: 汝等長夜於諸眾生常思利益，起大慈心，願與安樂，以是因緣，能令汝等現受勝報。
translation: For a long time, you always thought about the benefits of sentient beings, arouse great kindness, and wished for their well-being, and because of these causes and conditions, you'll be able to experience excellent rewards in the present.

source_sentence: 若有人王恭敬供養此《金光明》最勝經典，汝等應當勤加守護，令得安隱。
translation: If there are kings who respect and make offerings to this most excellent sūtra, Golden Light, you should diligently guard it so that you can be comfortable.

source_sentence: 汝諸四王及餘眷屬無量無數百千藥叉護是經者，即是護持去、來、現在諸佛正法。
translation: You four kings and the rest of your retinues who guard this sūtra are guarding the right Dharma of the past, future, and present buddhas.

source_sentence: 汝等四王及餘天眾并諸藥叉，與阿蘇羅共鬪戰時，常得勝利；汝等若能護持是經，由經力故，能除眾苦、怨賊、飢饉及諸疾疫。
translation: When you four kings and the rest of the celestials and yakṣas fight with Asura, you'll always get victory; if you can protect this sūtra, the power of the sūtra will remove suffering, enemies, hunger, and epidemics.

source_sentence: 是故汝等若見四眾受持讀誦此經王者，亦應勤心共加守護，為除衰惱，施與安樂。」
translation: Therefore, if you see the four groups of people who memorize and recite this sūtra, you should also diligently guard it together, so that you can remove their troubles and give them comfort."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王即從座起，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，合掌恭敬白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the four heavenly kings rose from their seats, bared their right shoulders, knelt on their right knees, put their palms together in respect, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此《金光明最勝經王》，於未來世，若有國土城邑聚落、山林曠野，隨所至處流布之時，若彼國王於此經典至心聽受，稱歎供養，并復供給受持是經四部之眾，深心擁護，令離衰惱，以是因緣，我護彼王及諸人眾，皆令安隱，遠離憂苦，增益壽命，威德具足。
translation: "When this Sutra of Golden Light, King of the Most Excellent Sutras is distributed in the future in lands, cities, villages, mountains, forests, and wildernesses wherever they go, if the king of that country wholeheartedly listens to this sūtra, praises and makes offerings to it, and also makes offerings to the people who accept and uphold the four parts of this sūtra and deeply guard them so that they're free from trouble, then I'll protect that king and all the people there, making them all secure, free from sorrow and suffering, increasing their life expectancy, and replete with authoritative qualities.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若彼國王見於四眾受持經者，恭敬守護猶如父母，一切所須悉皆供給，我等四王常為守護，令諸有情無不尊敬。
translation: "If those four kings see that the four people who accept and hold the sūtras are respectful and guard them like parents, and they make offerings to everything that's necessary, we four kings will always guard them, so that no sentient being is left without respect.

source_sentence: 是故我等并與無量藥叉諸神，隨此經王所流布處，潛身擁護，令無留難，亦當護念聽是經人諸國王等，除其衰患，悉令安隱，他方怨賊皆使退散。
translation: Therefore, we and the measureless Yakṣa gods will follow the king of this sūtra wherever it spreads, shield him personally so that there are no difficulties, and guard and remember the kings of countries that listen to this sūtra, removing their troubles and making them all secure, so that enemies and thieves from other directions will retreat.

source_sentence: 若有人王聽是經時，隣國怨敵興如是念：『當具四兵壞彼國土。』
translation: When a king hears this sūtra, the enemies of that neighboring country think, 'They will bring four armies to destroy their land.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以是經王威神力故，是時隣敵更有異怨，而來侵擾於其境界，多諸災變疫病流行。
translation: Because of the sūtras and the king's authority, another enemy from the neighboring countries had a different grudge against them and came to disturb their realms, causing numerous disasters and epidemics to spread.

source_sentence: 時王見已即嚴四兵，發向彼國欲為討罰。
translation: Seeing this, the king then decorated his four armies and sent them to that country to punish them.

source_sentence: 我等爾時當與眷屬無量無邊藥叉諸神，各自隱形為作護助，令彼怨敵自然降伏，尚不敢來至其國界，豈復得有兵戈相罰。」
translation: We then will assist him and our retinue of measureless and limitless yakṣa gods by stealthily taking on our own forms so that his enemies will be naturally subdued and won't dare to come to his realm, so how could they be punished by arms and weapons?"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告四天王：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the four heavenly kings, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝等四王，乃能擁護如是經典。
translation: You four kings are able to uphold such a scripture.

source_sentence: 我於過去百千俱胝那庾多劫，修諸苦行，得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，證一切智，今說是法。
translation: In the past 100,000 koṭīnayutas and eons, I cultivated ascetic practices, attained unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and realized omniscience, and now I explain this teaching.

source_sentence: 若有人王受持是經，恭敬供養者，為消衰患，令其安隱，亦復擁護城邑聚落，乃至怨賊悉令退散，亦令一切贍部洲內所有諸王，永無衰惱鬪諍之事。
translation: If a king accepts this sūtra and respects and makes offerings to it, it will help to end bad fortune and make him comfortable, and it will also protect cities and towns and cause even enemies and thieves to retreat, and it will prevent all the kings of the Jambudvīpa continent from ever being troubled or confronted by disputes.

source_sentence: 四王當知！
translation: The four kings should know!

source_sentence: 此贍部洲八萬四千城邑聚落、八萬四千諸人王等，各於其國受諸快樂，皆得自在，所有財寶豐足受用，不相侵奪，隨彼宿因而受其報，不起惡念貪求他國，咸生少欲利樂之心，無有鬪戰繫縛等苦。
translation: In each of these 84,000 cities and villages on the Jambudvīpa continent, 84,000 people and kings enjoy the pleasures of their country, are at ease, have an abundance of possessions and treasures to enjoy, don't fight each other, receive the results of their past lives, don't harbor bad thoughts about other countries, have few desires and benefits, and aren't tied down by fights and other sufferings.

source_sentence: 其土人民自生愛樂，上下和穆，猶如水乳，情相愛重，歡喜遊戲，慈悲謙讓，增長善根。
translation: The people of that land are delighted with themselves, are harmonious up and down like water and milk, love each other, rejoice, play, are compassionate and humble, and develop good roots.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，此贍部洲安隱豐樂，人民熾盛，大地沃壤，寒暑調和，時不乖序，日月星宿常度無虧，風雨隨時，離諸災橫，資產財寶皆悉豐盈，心無慳鄙，常行慧施，具十善業，若人命終，多生天上，增益天眾。
translation: As a result, this Jambudvīpa is peaceful and prosperous, its people flourish, the earth is fertile, the cold and heat are tempered, the seasons don't misbehave, the sun, moon, stars, and constellations are always in perfect harmony, the wind and rain come at regular intervals, they're free from disasters, their assets and treasures are all abundant, their minds are not stingy, they always practice wise generosity, and they perform the ten good actions, so that when their lives end, they're often born in the heavens and gain access to a multitude of gods.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 若未來世有諸人王聽受是經，恭敬供養并受持是經，四部之眾尊重稱讚。
translation: "If there are human kings in the future who hear and accept this sūtra, respect and make offerings to it, and accept its maintenance, the four groups of people will honor and praise them.

source_sentence: 復欲安樂饒益汝等及諸眷屬無量百千諸藥叉眾，是故彼王常當聽受是妙經王，由得聞此正法之水甘露上味，增益汝等身心勢力，精進勇猛，福德威光悉令充滿。
translation: They also want to comfortably benefit you and your retinues, the countless hundreds of thousands of yakṣas, so that king will always listen to this wonderful sūtra, and because hearing this right Dharma water is the best-tasting nectar, it will increase your physical and mental strength, increase your energy and vigor, and fill you with the radiance of merit.

source_sentence: 是諸人王若能至心聽受是經，則為廣大希有供養，供養於我釋迦牟尼應、正等覺。
translation: If these human kings wholeheartedly listen to and accept this sūtra, then it will be a vast and rare offering to me, Śākyamuni, the worthy and perfectly enlightened one.

source_sentence: 若供養我，則是供養過去、未來、現在百千俱胝那庾多佛。
translation: If they make offerings to me, they're making offerings to a hundred thousand koṭīnayutas of buddhas past, future, and present.

source_sentence: 若能供養三世諸佛，則得無量不可思議功德之聚。
translation: If you can make offerings to the buddhas of the three times, you'll attain an unfathomable stock of unfathomable merit.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，汝等應當擁護彼王后妃眷屬，令無衰惱，及宮宅神常受安樂，功德難思，是諸國土所有人民，亦受種種五欲之樂，一切惡事皆令消殄。」
translation: For this reason, you should protect that king's retinue and retinue's retinue so that they won't be troubled and that the gods of their palaces will always enjoy well-being and unfathomable merit, and all the people of those lands will also experience the various pleasures of the five desires, and all bad deeds will be eliminated."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the four heavenly kings said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於未來世，若有人王，樂聽如是《金光明經》，為欲擁護自身、后妃、王子，乃至內宮諸婇女等，城邑宮殿，皆得第一不可思議最上歡喜寂靜安樂，於現世中，王位尊高，自在昌盛，常得增長，復欲攝受無量無邊難思福聚，於自國土令無怨敵及諸憂惱災厄事者。
translation: "In the future, if there are people who listen with joy to this Sutra of Golden Light, then in order to protect themselves, their wives, princes, and inner palaces and palaces, they'll attain the highest, most unfathomable joy, tranquility, and happiness, and in the present life, the king's position will be exalted, comfortable, and prosperous, and he'll always be able to grow, and he'll want to gather an unfathomable stock of merit that's measureless and limitless, and make his land free of enemies and other troubles and calamities.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是人王不應放逸令心散亂，當生恭敬至誠殷重，聽受如是最勝經王。
translation: Thus, the human king shouldn't let his mind be distracted by idleness, but he should be respectful, sincere, and respectful as he listens to and accepts such a most excellent sūtra, King.

source_sentence: 欲聽之時，先當莊嚴最上宮室，王所愛重顯敞之處，香水灑地，散眾名花，安置師子殊勝法座，以諸珍寶而為挍飾，張施種種寶蓋幢幡，燒無價香，奏諸音樂。
translation: When he desires to listen, he must first adorn the most distinguished palace, a place that the king treasures and displays, sprinkle perfume on the ground, scatter flowers of renown, place a lion's excellent Dharma throne, adorn it with various treasures, spread out various kinds of jeweled canopies and banners, burn priceless incense, and play music.

source_sentence: 其王爾時當淨澡浴，以香塗身，著新淨衣及諸瓔珞，坐小卑座，不生高舉，捨自在位，離諸憍慢，端心正念，聽是經王；於法師所，起大師想。
translation: The king then should bathe himself in purity, rub his body with incense, put on new, pure clothing and jewelry, sit on a small, lowly seat, refrain from exaltation, abandon his position of sovereignty, part with pride, and focus his mind with correct concentration as he listens to this sūtra.

source_sentence: 復於宮內后妃王子婇女眷屬生慈愍心，喜悅相視，和顏軟語，於自身心大喜充遍。
translation: Also, he became compassionate toward the inner palace's queens, princes, and ladies, looked at them with joy and happiness, spoke softly and kindly, and filled his own heart with great joy.

source_sentence: 作如是念：『我今獲得難思殊勝廣大利益，於此經王，盛興供養。』
translation: He had this thought, 'Now, I've received an unfathomably great and vast benefit, and here's the king of sūtras making offerings in abundance.'

source_sentence: 既敷設已，見法師至，當起虔敬渴仰之心。」
translation: Once you've made your offerings, when you see the Dharma teacher arrive, you must give rise to reverence and longing."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告四天王：「不應如是不迎法師。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the four heavenly kings, "You shouldn't not welcome the Dharma teacher like this.

source_sentence: 時彼人王應著純淨鮮潔之衣，種種瓔珞以為嚴飾，自持白蓋及以香花，備整軍儀，盛陳音樂，步出城闕迎彼法師，運想虔恭為吉祥事。
translation: That human king should then put on pure and clean clothing, adorn himself with various kinds of jewelry, carry his own white canopy and scented flowers, prepare his troops with proper attire, present music in full, and march out of the city fort to greet the Dharma teacher, imagining reverent and auspicious things.

source_sentence: 四王！
translation: Four kings!

source_sentence: 以何因緣令彼人王親作如是恭敬供養？
translation: What are the causes that cause that human king to make such respectful offerings?

source_sentence: 由彼人王舉足下足，步步即是恭敬供養、承事尊重百千萬億那庾多諸佛世尊，復得超越如是劫數生死之苦，復於來世如是劫數，當受輪王殊勝尊位。
translation: As he raises his feet and steps down, that human king respects, serves, and venerates a hundred thousand million nayutas of the world-honored buddhas, transcends the suffering of birth-and-death for many eons, and will be accorded the distinguished position of wheel-turning king in many eons to come.

source_sentence: 隨其步步，亦於現世福德增長自在為王，感應難思，眾所欽重；當於無量百千億劫人天受用七寶宮殿，所在生處常得為王，增益壽命，言詞辯了，人天信受，無所畏懼，有大名稱，咸共瞻仰，天上人中受勝妙樂，獲大力勢，有大威德，身相奇妙，端嚴無比，值天人師，遇善知識，成就具足無量福聚。
translation: Following his steps, he'll also grow in merit in the present life and become a king unimpeded, with inconceivable perceptions and much esteem; he'll be employed in a palace of seven treasures among humans and gods for measureless hundreds of billions of eons, always become king where he's born, gain longevity, speak eloquently, be trusted and accepted by humans and gods without fear, have a great reputation that's widely admired, experience surpassing marvelous happiness among gods and humans, attain great power and authority, have marvelous appearances and unsurpassed dignity, meet gods and humans as teachers, encounter good friends, and achieve a replete stock of measureless merits.

source_sentence: 四王當知！
translation: The four kings should know!

source_sentence: 彼諸人王見如是等種種無量功德利益故，應自往奉迎法師。
translation: Seeing these kinds of immeasurable merits and benefits, those human kings should go on their own to greet the Dharma teacher.

source_sentence: 若一踰繕那，乃至百千踰繕那，於說法師應生佛想，還至城已，作如是念：『今日釋迦牟尼如來、應、正等覺入我宮中，受我供養，為我說法。
translation: If it takes one yojana or even a hundred thousand yojana, they should give rise to the idea that the Dharma preacher is a buddha, and when they return to the city, they think, 'Today, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, the Worthy One and the Perfectly Enlightened One, entered my palace, accepted my offerings, and taught me the Dharma.

source_sentence: 我聞法已，即於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提不復退轉，即是值遇百千萬億那庾多諸佛世尊。
translation: After hearing the teaching, I will no longer retrogress from the unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, or I will meet one hundred thousand million nayutas of world-honored buddhas.

source_sentence: 我於今日即是種種廣大殊勝上妙樂具，供養過去、未來、現在諸佛。
translation: Today, I am making offerings to the buddhas of the past, future, and present with a variety of vast, excellent, and highly marvelous implements of joy.

source_sentence: 我於今日即是永拔琰摩王界、地獄、餓鬼、傍生之苦。
translation: Today, I'm permanently liberating Diem from the suffering of the king's realm, hell, hungry ghosts, and unenlightened people.

source_sentence: 便為已種無量百千萬億轉輪聖王、釋梵天主善根種子。
translation: I've planted measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of seeds of the good roots of the wheel-turning sage king and the lord of the Brahmā gods.

source_sentence: 當令無量百千萬億眾生，出生死苦，得涅槃樂，積集無量無邊不可思議福德之聚，後宮眷屬及諸人民皆蒙安隱，國土清泰，無諸災厄、毒害、惡人，他方怨敵不來侵擾，遠離憂患。』
translation: They will cause measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of sentient beings to escape the suffering of birth-and-death and attain the bliss of nirvāṇa, amass an unfathomable stock of merit that knows no bounds, make their harems and people secure, make their lands peaceful, avoid calamity, poison, and evil people, and keep enemies from coming from other lands, thus avoiding misfortune.'

source_sentence: 四王當知！
translation: The four kings should know!

source_sentence: 時彼人王應作如是尊重正法，亦於受持是妙經典苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦，供養恭敬尊重讚歎，所獲善根，先以勝福施與汝等及諸眷屬。
translation: The human king then should thus honor the right teaching, and he should also give you and your retinue the good roots gained from making offerings to, honoring, respecting, and praising the buddies, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsaka, and upāsikā who uphold this wonderful sūtra.

source_sentence: 彼之人王，有大福德善業因緣，於現世中得大自在增益威光，吉祥妙相皆悉莊嚴，一切怨敵能以正法而摧伏之。」
translation: That human king has great merit and the causes and conditions of good actions, and in the present life he attains great sovereignty and enhanced radiance, and his auspicious and marvelous features are all adorned, so that all enemies can be defeated by the right teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the four heavenly kings said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人王能作如是恭敬正法，聽此經王，并於四眾持經之人，恭敬供養，尊重讚歎。
translation: "Suppose there's a king who thus respects the right teaching, listens to this sūtra, and makes respectful offerings to the four bearers of the sūtra, honoring and praising them.

source_sentence: 時彼人王欲為我等生歡喜故，當在一邊，近於法座，香水灑地，散眾名花，安置處所，設四王座，我與彼王共聽正法。
translation: That human king then, desiring to make us happy, would place us on one side near the Dharma throne, sprinkle perfume on the ground, scatter flowers of fame, place us in a place, and set up four royal seats, where we would listen to the right teaching together with that king.

source_sentence: 其王所有自利善根，亦以福分施及我等。
translation: Whatever good roots that king has for his own benefit, he'll also give to us with a share of his merits.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時彼人王請說法者，昇座之時，便為我等燒眾名香，供養是經。
translation: When that king of men invited the Dharma speaker to ascend to his seat, he burned many famous incense sticks for us and offered them to this sūtra.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時彼香煙於一念頃，上昇虛空，即至我等諸天宮殿，於虛空中變成香蓋。
translation: In an instant of thought, that fragrant smoke rises up into the sky and reaches the palaces of our gods, where it becomes a shroud of incense in the sky.

source_sentence: 我等天眾聞彼妙香，香有金光照曜我等所居宮殿，乃至梵宮及以帝釋、大辯才天、大吉祥天、堅牢地神、正了知大將、二十八部諸藥叉神、大自在天、金剛密主、寶賢大將、訶利底母五百眷屬、無熱惱池龍王、大海龍王所居之處。
translation: When we gods heard that wonderful fragrance, it had a golden glow that shone brightly from our palaces to the palace of Brahmā, the palace of Indra, the god of great eloquence, the god of great good fortune, the god of firmament, the general of correct understanding, the 28 yakṣa deities, the god of great freedom, the vajra-mystic lord, the great general of the jewels, 500 members of Hāritī's retinue, the dragon king of the nonheating pond, and the dragon king of the ocean.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是等眾於自宮殿見彼香煙，一剎那頃變成香蓋，聞香芬馥，覩色光明，遍至一切諸天神宮。」
translation: Such a multitude of people in their own palace see that fragrant smoke, which in a moment turns into an incense canopy, and they hear the fragrance and see the color and brilliance that reach the palaces of all the gods."

source_sentence: 佛告四天王：「是香光明非但至此宮殿，變成香蓋，放大光明；由彼人王手擎香鑪，燒眾名香供養經時，其香煙氣於一念頃遍至三千大千世界，百億日月、百億妙高山王、百億四洲，於此三千大千世界一切天、龍、藥叉、健闥婆、阿蘇羅、揭路茶、緊那羅、莫呼洛伽宮殿之所，於虛空中充滿而住。
translation: The Buddha told the four heavenly kings, "That fragrant brightness doesn't just reach this palace and turn into an incense canopy that magnifies its light; when that human king holds a censer in his hand and burns many famous incense sticks to make offerings to the sutras, its fragrant breath reaches a thousand great thousand worlds, ten billion suns and moons, ten billion wonderful high mountain kings, and ten billion four continents in a single moment of thought, and fills the sky with the palaces of all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas in these three thousand great thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 種種香煙變成雲蓋，其蓋金色普照天宮。
translation: The various kinds of fragrant smoke transform into cloud canopies, and their canopies are golden and shine universally from the palace of the gods.

source_sentence: 如是三千大千世界所有種種香雲香蓋，皆是《金光明最勝王經》威神之力。
translation: All of these various clouds of fragrance and lids of incense in a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds are the result of the authoritative power of the Sutra of Golden Light, the Foremost King.

source_sentence: 是諸人王手持香鑪供養經時，種種香氣非但遍此三千大千世界，於一念頃亦遍十方無量無邊恒河沙等百千萬億諸佛國土，於諸佛上虛空之中變成香蓋，金色普照亦復如是。
translation: When these human kings held the incense tray in their hands to make offerings to the sūtra, the various fragrances not only spread throughout this 3,000,000 worlds but also, in an instant of thought, spread throughout the measureless and limitless Ganges River Sands and hundreds of thousands of millions of buddha lands in the ten directions, turning into fragrant canopies in the sky above the buddhas, which also shone golden and universal.

source_sentence: 時彼諸佛聞此妙香，覩斯雲蓋及以金色，於十方界恒河沙等諸佛世尊現神變已，彼諸世尊悉共觀察，異口同音讚法師曰：『善哉！
translation: When the buddhas heard this wonderful fragrance and saw this canopy of clouds and gold color, the world-honored buddhas of the Ganges River Sands in the ten directions appeared miraculously, and the world-honored buddhas all observed it together and praised the Dharma teacher with one voice, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝大丈夫！
translation: You're a great man!

source_sentence: 能廣流布如是甚深微妙經典，則為成就無量無邊不可思議福德之聚。
translation: When such a profound and subtle sūtra is widely disseminated, it accomplishes an unfathomably large amount of merit that's measureless and limitless.

source_sentence: 若有聽聞如是經者，所獲功德其量甚多，何況書寫、受持、讀誦、為他敷演、如說修行。
translation: If someone hears such a sūtra, the amount of merit they'll attain is enormous, not to mention writing it down, retaining it, reciting it, expounding it for others, and cultivating it as it's taught.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 若有眾生聞此《金光明最勝王經》者，即於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提不復退轉。』」
translation: If sentient beings hear this Sutra of Golden Light, the Most Excellent King, they will no longer retrogress from unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，十方有百千俱胝那庾多無量無數恒河沙等諸佛剎土，彼諸剎土一切如來異口同音，於法座上讚彼法師言：「善哉！
translation: At the time, there were hundreds of thousands of koṭīs, an infinite number of incalculable rhesus sand buddha-lands in ten directions, and all the tathāgatas of those buddha-lands spoke with one voice, praising the teacher from their Dharma seats, saying, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝於來世，以精勤力，當修無量百千苦行，具足資糧，超諸聖眾，出過三界，為最勝尊，當坐菩提樹王之下，殊勝莊嚴，能救三千大千世界有緣眾生，善能摧伏可畏形儀諸魔軍眾，覺了諸法最勝清淨甚深無上正等菩提。
translation: In a future life, with the power of diligence, you will cultivate measureless hundreds of thousands of ascetic practices, become fully accumulated, surpass the noble ones, transcend the three realms, and become the most honored one who will sit beneath the king of the bodhi tree, be remarkably adorned, be able to save sentient beings with conditions in a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, skillfully subdue armies of Māra with fearsome forms and manners, and realize the most excellent, pure, and profound unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝當坐於金剛之座，轉於無上諸佛所讚十二妙行甚深法輪，能擊無上最大法鼓，能吹無上極妙法螺，能建無上殊勝法幢，能然無上極明法炬，能降無上甘露法雨，能斷無量煩惱怨結，能令無量百千萬億那庾多有情，渡於無涯可畏大海，解脫生死無際輪迴，值遇無量百千萬億那庾多佛。」
translation: You will sit on the adamantine throne and turn the Dharma wheel of unsurpassed twelve marvelous actions praised by the buddhas, which can beat the unsurpassed maximum Dharma drum, blow the unsurpassed most sublime Dharma conch, build the unsurpassed excellent Dharma banner, produce the unsurpassed most luminous Dharma torch, rain down the unsurpassed sweet dew Dharma rain, cut the bonds of affliction and enmity, and cause measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of nayutas to wade across the endless and fearless ocean, liberate sentient beings from the endless cycle of birth and death, and meet measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of nayutas."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the four heavenly kings again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是《金光明最勝王經》，能於未來現在成就如是無量功德，是故人王若得聞是微妙經典，即是已於百千萬億無量佛所種諸善根，於彼人王我當護念。
translation: "This is the Sutra of Golden Light, Most Excellent King, which can achieve such measureless merit in the future and present, so if a human king hears this subtle sūtra, that means he has planted good roots in one hundred thousand million million measureless buddha-places, and I will guard and remember that human king.

source_sentence: 復見無量福德利故，我等四王及餘眷屬無量百千萬億諸神，於自宮殿見是種種香煙雲蓋神變之時，我當隱蔽不現其身，為聽法故，當至是王清淨嚴飾所止宮殿講法之處。
translation: Furthermore, when we four kings and the rest of our retinue see these various miraculous transformations of smoke and clouds in our palace, I will hide myself from them and go to the palace where the king's pure and ornamented palace is used for teaching the Dharma in order to listen to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 如是乃至梵宮、帝釋、大辯才天、大吉祥天、堅牢地神、正了知神大將、二十八部諸藥叉神、大自在天、金剛密主、寶賢大將、訶利底母五百眷屬、無熱惱池龍王、大海龍王、無量百千萬億那庾多諸天藥叉，如是等眾為聽法故，皆不現身，至彼人王殊勝宮殿莊嚴高座說法之所。
translation: Thus, up to the Brahma palace, Indra, the god of great eloquence, the god of great good fortune, the god of firm ground, the great general of the gods who correctly understand, the 28 divisions of the yakṣa gods, the great self-penetrating gods, the vajra-mystic lord, the great general of the jewels, 500 members of Hāritī's retinue, the dragon king of the unafflicted pond, the dragon king of the ocean, and measureless hundreds of thousands of thousands of thousands of nayutas of gods, all of these people would withdraw their bodies and go to that special palace of the king of men where he speaks the Dharma from an ornate, high seat.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等四王及餘眷屬藥叉諸神，皆當一心共彼人王為善知識，因是無上大法施主，以甘露味充足於我，是故我等擁護是王，除其衰患，令得安隱，及其宮殿城邑國土諸惡災變悉令消滅。」
translation: We four kings and the rest of our retinue, the Yakṣa gods, should all join together with one mind to make that human king a good teacher who fills us with the taste of ambrosia because he's the unsurpassed great donor of the Dharma; therefore, we will protect him, remove his troubles, make him comfortable, and extinguish all the bad calamities in his palace, city, and land."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王俱共合掌白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the four heavenly kings all joined their palms together and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人王於其國土，雖有此經，未常流布，心生捨離，不樂聽聞，亦不供養尊重讚歎，見四部眾持經之人，亦復不能尊重供養，遂令我等及餘眷屬無量諸天，不得聞此甚深妙法，背甘露味，失正法流，無有威光及以勢力，增長惡趣，損減人天，墜生死河，乖涅槃路。
translation: If there's a king in his land who has this sūtra but doesn't always disseminate it, whose mind is discarded, doesn't enjoy listening to it, doesn't make offerings, respects and praises it, and doesn't respect and offer support to the four groups of sūtra-holders, then we and the rest of our retinue of measureless gods won't be able to hear this very profound and wonderful teaching, will depart from the taste of ambrosia, lose the flow of the right Dharma, lack authority and strength, grow into bad destinies, diminish humans and gods, fall into the river of birth-and-death, and deviate from the path to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等四王并諸眷屬及藥叉等，見如斯事，捨其國土，無擁護心。
translation: Seeing this, the four of us kings, our retinues, and Yakṣa abandoned their lands, lacking the intention to defend them.

source_sentence: 非但我等捨棄是王，亦有無量守護國土諸大善神悉皆捨去。
translation: Not only have we abandoned this king, but countless other great good spirits who guard the land have also abandoned it.

source_sentence: 既捨離已，其國當有種種災禍，喪失國位，一切人眾皆無善心，惟有繫縛，殺害瞋諍，互相讒諂，抂及無辜，疾疫流行，彗星數出，兩日並現，博蝕無恒，黑白二虹表不祥相，星流地動，井內發聲，暴雨惡風不依時節，常遭飢饉，苗實不成，多有他方怨賊侵掠，國內人民受諸苦惱，土地無有可樂之處。
translation: After they abandon them, that country will be struck by various calamities, lose its position, have people with no good intentions who are bound to killing, anger, mutual flattery, unjust and innocent people, become plagued by epidemics, have numerous comets that appear twice as often as the sun, erode without constancy, have black and white rainbows that show inauspicious appearances, have stars flowing down, make noises in wells, have torrential rains and bad winds that don't follow the seasons, experience constant hunger, fail to produce seedlings, be plundered by enemies and thieves from other directions, subject the people of that country to suffering, and have no place on the land that's pleasant.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等四王及與無量百千天神，并護國土諸舊善神遠離去時，生如是等無量百千災怪惡事。
translation: When the four of us kings and measureless hundreds of thousands of celestials and the old good spirits guarding the land left, these measureless hundreds of thousands of calamities and bad things occurred.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有人王欲護國土，常受快樂，欲令眾生咸蒙安隱，欲得摧伏一切外敵，於自國境永得昌盛，欲令正教流布世間，苦惱惡法皆除滅者。
translation: "Suppose there's a king who wants to protect his land, make it always happy, make sentient beings comfortable, subdue all external enemies, permanently prosper in his own land, and spread the right teaching throughout the world so that all painful and awful things are removed.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是諸國主必當聽受是妙經王，亦應恭敬供養讀誦受持經者。
translation: The lords of these lands must listen to and accept this wonderful sūtra, King, and they should also respect and offer support to those who read, recite, and uphold it.

source_sentence: 我等及餘無量天眾以是聽法善根威力，得服無上甘露法味，增益我等所有眷屬，并餘天神皆得勝利。
translation: Because of the power of the good roots of listening to the teaching, we and the countless other gods will be able to consume the taste of the unsurpassed nectar of the Dharma, which will give rise to superior benefits for all of our retinues and the other gods.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以是人王至心聽受是經典故。
translation: That's why the king of men listened with utmost attention to this sūtra's explanation.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如大梵天於諸有情常為宣說世出世論，帝釋復說種種諸論，五通神仙亦說諸論。
translation: Just as the Brahma gods always explain the Treatise on the World and Beyond to sentient beings, Indra also explains various treatises, and the five supernormal celestials also explain treatises.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 梵天、帝釋、五通仙人雖有百千俱胝那庾多無量諸論，然佛世尊慈悲哀愍，為人天眾說《金光明》微妙經典，比前所說，勝彼百千俱胝那庾多倍不可為喻。
translation: Although Brahmā, Indra, and the five sages of supernormal power have an infinite number of treatises that amount to a hundred thousand koṭīs and nayutas, the Bhagavān, in his compassion and kindness, spoke the subtle sūtra Golden Light for a multitude of people and gods, which is ineffable compared to what was previously taught.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由此能令諸贍部洲所有王等正法化世，能與眾生安樂之事，為護自身及諸眷屬，令無苦惱，又無他方怨賊侵害，所有諸惡悉皆遠去，亦令國土災厄屏除，化以正法無有諍訟。
translation: This enables all the kings of the jambudvīpa to teach the world the right Dharma, to work for the welfare of sentient beings, to protect themselves and their retinues from suffering and trouble, to be untouched by enemies and thieves from other directions, to keep all evil [activities] far away, to remove calamity and misfortune from their lands, and to teach the right Dharma without strife.

source_sentence: 是故人王各於國土，當然法炬，明照無邊，增益天眾并諸眷屬。
translation: Therefore, each human king certainly has a torch of the Dharma that shines brightly and without limit in his land, which benefits the gods and their retinues.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等四王無量天神藥叉之眾，贍部洲內所有天神，以是因緣得服無上甘露法味，獲大威德勢力光明無不具足，一切眾生皆得安隱，復於來世無量百千不可思議那庾多劫常受快樂，復得值遇無量諸佛，種諸善根，然後證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, we, the four kings and measureless hosts of celestials and yakṣas, and all the gods on the Jambudvīpa continent, have obtained the taste of the unsurpassed nectar of dharma, attained great authority, power, and unsurpassed radiance, attained peace for all sentient beings, remained happy for measureless hundreds of thousands of unfathomable nayuta eons in the future, and then encountered measureless buddhas and planted good roots before realizing supreme, perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 如是無量無邊勝利，皆是如來、應、正等覺，以大慈悲過諸梵眾，以大智慧逾於帝釋，修諸苦行勝五通仙，百千萬億那庾多倍不可稱計，為諸眾生演說如是微妙經典，令贍部洲一切國主及諸人眾，明了世間所有法式，治國化人勸導之事，由此經王流通力故，普得安樂。
translation: Such measureless and limitless benefits are all the result of the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Perfectly Enlightened One, who with great compassion surpasses the Brahmās, with great wisdom surpasses Indra, cultivates ascetic practices that surpass the five sages, and with a hundred thousand million nayutas times incalculable, expounds such subtle scriptures for sentient beings, causing all the lords of the Jambudvīpa countries and their people to understand all the ways of the world and the things that govern countries, teach people, and encourage them, and because of the power of the king's circulation of these scriptures, they all attain well-being.

source_sentence: 此等福利，皆是釋迦大師於此經典廣為流通慈悲力故。
translation: All of these benefits are due to the compassionate power of the Śākyamuni teacher's extensive circulation of this sūtra.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以是因緣，諸人王等皆應受持，供養恭敬，尊重讚歎此妙經王。
translation: Because of these reasons, all you kings should accept, offer support, respect, and praise this wonderful king of sūtras.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以如是等不可思議殊勝功德利益一切，是故名曰最勝經王。」
translation: Because unfathomably outstanding qualities like these benefit all of them, they're therefore called the most excellent sūtra kings."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告四天王：「汝等四王及餘眷屬，無量百千俱胝那庾多諸天大眾，見彼人王，若能至心聽是經典，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎者，應當擁護，除其衰患，能令汝等亦受安樂；若四部眾能廣流布是經王者，於人天中廣作佛事，普能利益無量眾生，如是之人，汝等四王常當擁護。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the four celestial kings, "You four kings and the rest of your retinues, measureless hundreds of thousands of koṭīs and gods, if you see that human king and can wholeheartedly listen to this sūtra, offer support, respect, and praise him, you should support him, remove his troubles, and cause you to also experience well-being; if the four groups of people can widely disseminate this sūtra king and perform extensive Buddha-works among humans and gods, which can thoroughly benefit measureless sentient beings, such people should always be supported by you four kings.

source_sentence: 如是四眾，勿使他緣共相侵擾，令彼身心寂靜安樂，於此經王廣宣流布，令不斷絕，利益有情，盡未來際。」
translation: Thus, don't allow these four groups of people to be disturbed by the commonality of other conditions, so that they may be calm and comfortable in body and mind, and then disseminate this sūtra king so widely that it won't be cut off, benefiting sentient beings for as long as the future holds."

source_sentence: 爾時，多聞天王從座而起，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the god king of many learners rose from his seat and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我有如意寶珠陀羅尼法，若有眾生樂受持者，功德無量。
translation: "I have a wish-granting jewel dhāraṇī that will have immeasurable merit if sentient beings happily accept it.

source_sentence: 我常擁護令彼眾生離苦得樂，能成福智二種資糧。
translation: I will always protect them so that sentient beings will part with suffering and attain happiness, and I'll be able to cultivate the two kinds of accumulation of merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 欲受持者先當誦此護身之呪。」
translation: Those who want to uphold it should first recite this body-protecting dhāraṇī."

translation: I then transform my body into the form of a small child, or an old man or a bhikṣu, hold a wish-granting precious pearl and carry a gold bag into the site of the dhāraṇī, show respect, call the Buddha by name, and say to the person holding the dhāraṇī, 'Whatever you ask, I will grant you your wish.'

source_sentence: 或隱林藪，或造寶珠，或欲眾人愛寵，或求金銀等物，欲持諸呪，皆令有驗。
translation: Sometimes they hide in a forest or a marsh, make a precious pearl, seek the favor of many people, or ask for gold or silver, or other things, and then they want to uphold the spell to have them all fulfilled.

source_sentence: 或欲神通壽命長遠，及勝妙樂，無不稱心。
translation: They may want long life and marvelous happiness from their psychic powers, and nothing is beyond their desires.

source_sentence: 我今且說如是之事，若更求餘，皆隨所願，悉得成就，寶藏無盡，功德無窮。
translation: Now, I'll explain that if I were to ask for anything else, it would be done according to your wishes, and there would be an inexhaustible store of treasures and limitless merit.

source_sentence: 假使日月墜墮于地，或可大地有時移轉，我此實語終不虛然，常得安隱，隨心快樂。
translation: Even if the sun and moon were to fall to the ground, or if the earth were to shift sometime, these true words of mine would never be false, and I would always attain peace and happiness at will.

translation: If someone can memorize and recite this dhāraṇī, they won't need to tire when reciting this dhāraṇī, and the teaching will be accomplished quickly.

source_sentence: 世尊！

source_sentence: 我今為彼貧窮困厄苦惱眾生，說此神呪，令獲大利，皆得富樂，自在無患，乃至盡形，我當擁護，隨逐是人，為除災厄。
translation: Now, for those poor, disadvantaged, and afflicted sentient beings, I will recite this divine spell to bring about great rewards, riches, and freedom from trouble, even up to the end of their lives, and I will guard and follow them around to remove misfortune and trouble.

source_sentence: 亦復令此持《金光明最勝王經》流通之者，及持呪人，於百步內光明照燭，我之所有千藥叉神亦常侍衛，隨欲驅使，無不遂心。
translation: I'll also cause this holder of the Golden Light Sutra of the Most Excellent King to circulate the spell and the person who holds it to shine their candles brightly within a hundred paces, and I'll have a thousand yakṣa spirits always at their service, dispatching them as I desire, and they will not fail to fulfill their intentions.

translation: King of Heaven!

source_sentence: 汝能破裂一切眾生貧窮苦網，令得富樂，說是神呪，復令此經廣行於世。」
translation: You can break the web of poverty and suffering of all sentient beings and make them rich and happy by reciting this incantation, and you can also make this sūtra widely available in the world."

source_sentence: 時四天王俱從座起，偏袒一肩，頂禮雙足，右膝著地，合掌恭敬，以妙伽他讚佛功德：「佛面猶如淨滿月，　　亦如千日放光明；　目淨脩廣若青蓮，　　齒白齊密猶珂雪。
translation: The four heavenly kings then all rose from their seats, bared one shoulder, bowed their heads at their feet, knelt on their right knee, put their palms together in respect, and praised the Buddha's merits with their wonderful kāṭas, "The Buddha's face is like a pure full moon, and it shines like a thousand suns; his eyes are pure and broad like a blue lotus, and his teeth are white and dense like snow.

source_sentence: 佛德無邊如大海，　　無限妙寶積其中；　智慧德水鎮恒盈，　　百千勝定咸充滿。
translation: The Buddha's virtue is limitless like the ocean, in which limitless marvelous treasures accumulate, and the waters of wisdom and virtue are constantly filled, so that a hundred thousand excellent concentrations are filled.

source_sentence: 足下輪相皆嚴飾，　　轂輞千輻悉齊平；　手足鞔網遍莊嚴，　　猶如鵝王相具足。
translation: The underfoot features of the wheel are all adorned, and the hubs of the thousand spokes are all even, while the hands and feet are adorned with a web of red sandals, just like a king goose with an array of features.

source_sentence: 佛身光曜等金山，　　清淨殊特無倫匹；　亦如妙高功德滿，　　故我稽首佛山王。
translation: The Buddha's body is a gleaming gold mountain of unsurpassed purity and distinction, and it's filled with marvelously high attributes, so I bow my head to the king of Buddha Mountain.

source_sentence: 相好如空不可測，　　逾於千月放光明；　皆如焰幻不思議，　　故我稽首心無著。」
translation: Its features are unfathomable like space, and it shines brighter than a thousand moons; they're all like flames and illusions that defy conceptualization, so I bow my head and mind without attachment."

source_sentence: 爾時，四天王讚歎佛已，世尊亦以伽他而答之曰：「此《金光明》最勝經，　　無上十力之所說；　汝等四王常擁護，　　應生勇猛不退心。
translation: After the four heavenly kings praised the Buddha, the Bhagavān also answered them with a reply, "This is the most excellent sūtra, the Golden Light, which is the teaching of unsurpassed ten powers; you four kings always embrace it, and you should give rise to a bold and unretrogressive mind.

source_sentence: 此妙經寶極甚深，　　能與一切有情樂；　由彼有情安樂故，　　常得流通贍部洲。
translation: The treasures of this wonderful sūtra are so profound that they can give pleasure to all sentient beings, and because of the well-being of those sentient beings, they'll always circulate in the Jambudvīpa continent.

source_sentence: 於此大千世界中，　　所有一切有情類；　餓鬼傍生及地獄，　　如是苦趣悉皆除。
translation: In this great chiliocosm, all sentient beings, hungry ghosts, animals, and hells are all removed from such painful destinies.

source_sentence: 住此南洲諸國王，　　及餘一切有情類；　由經威力常歡喜，　　皆蒙擁護得安寧。
translation: The kings of the southern continent and all other sentient beings who live here are always delighted by the power of the sūtras, and they are all protected and made to be at peace.

source_sentence: 亦使此中諸有情，　　除眾病苦無賊盜；　賴此國土弘經故，　　安隱豐樂無違惱。
translation: It also causes all the sentient beings here to be freed from illness and suffering and from thieves and robbers, and they rely on this land to promote the sūtras, so they're protected and made comfortable and abundant without discomfort.

source_sentence: 若人聽受此經王，　　欲求尊貴及財利；　國土豐樂無違諍，　　隨心所願悉皆從。
translation: If someone listens to this sūtra, the king desires to seek honor and wealth, and there's no disagreement about the land's abundance and happiness, they'll comply with whatever they wish.

source_sentence: 能令他方賊退散，　　於自國界常安隱；　由此最勝經王力，　　離諸苦惱無憂怖。
translation: It causes thieves from other lands to retreat, and they're always at ease in their own realm. By the power of the most excellent sūtra king, they're freed from suffering and anxiety and have no fear.

source_sentence: 如寶樹王在宅內，　　能生一切諸樂具；　最勝經王亦復然，　　能與人王勝功德。
translation: Like the king of jeweled trees in his home that produce all implements of pleasure, so too does the king of the most excellent sūtras, which can match the outstanding qualities of human kings.

source_sentence: 譬如澄潔清冷水，　　能除飢渴諸熱惱；　最勝經王亦復然，　　令樂福者心滿足。
translation: Like pure, clear, and cold water that removes hunger and thirst and the torment of heat, so too does the king of the most excellent sūtras, which satisfies the minds of those who enjoy happiness and merit.

source_sentence: 如人室有妙寶篋，　　隨所受用悉從心；　最勝經王亦復然，　　福德隨心無所乏。
translation: Like a man with a wonderful treasure chest in his abode that he uses as he wishes, so too does the king of the most excellent sūtras, whose virtues are unlimited according to his mind.

source_sentence: 汝等天主及天眾，　　應當供養此經王；　若能依教奉持經，　　智慧威神皆具足。
translation: You lords of heaven and gods should make offerings to this sūtra king; if you can teach and uphold the sūtra, your wisdom and authority will be complete.

source_sentence: 現在十方一切佛，　　咸共護念此經王；　見有讀誦及受持，　　稱歎善哉甚希有。
translation: Now, in the ten directions, all the buddhas share this sūtra king's protection and mindfulness, and when they see it being recited and adhered to, they praise it as excellent and quite rare.

source_sentence: 若有人能聽此經，　　身心踊躍生歡喜；　常有百千藥叉眾，　　隨所住處護斯人。
translation: If someone can listen to this sūtra, their body and mind jump with joy, and there are always a hundred thousand yakṣas protecting this person wherever they live.

source_sentence: 於此世界諸天眾，　　其數無量不思議；　悉共聽受此經王，　　歡喜護持無退轉。
translation: The number of gods in this world is unfathomable, and they all listen to and accept this sūtra, rejoicing and upholding it without turning back.

source_sentence: 若人聽受此經王，　　威德勇猛常自在；　增益一切人天眾，　　令離衰惱益光明。」
translation: If someone listens to and accepts this sūtra king, their authority, virtue, and boldness will always be sovereign; it will enhance all the people and gods and free them from discomfort and increase their radiance."

source_sentence: 爾時四天王聞是頌已，歡喜踊躍，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After hearing this verse, the four heavenly kings rejoiced and jumped for joy, saying to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從昔來未曾得聞如是甚深微妙之法。」
translation: Never before have I been able to hear such a profound and subtle teaching."

source_sentence: 心生悲喜，涕淚交流，舉身戰動，證不思議希有之事，以天曼陀羅花、摩訶曼陀羅花而散佛上。
translation: Overcome with compassion and joy, his heart exchanged tears, his body shook with emotion, and he realized that he didn't think about rare things and scattered the heavenly maṇḍala flowers and mahāmandala flowers on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 作是殊勝供養佛已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After making this remarkable offering to the Buddha, he said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等四王各有五百藥叉眷屬，常當處處擁護是經及說法師，以智光明而為助衛。
translation: We four kings each have 500 members of the Yakṣa clan who will always guard this sūtra and its Dharma preacher in every place, aiding and abetting them with the light of wisdom.

source_sentence: 若於此經所有句義忘失之處，我皆令彼憶念不忘，并與陀羅尼殊勝法門令得具足。
translation: If they forget any of the words or meanings of this sūtra, I'll cause them to remember them and not forget them, and I'll make them complete with the extraordinary Dharma teaching of the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 復欲令此最勝經王所在之處，為諸眾生廣宣流布，不速隱沒。」
translation: I also want to cause this most excellent sūtra to be widely disseminated for all sentient beings wherever the king of scriptures is, so that it won't quickly disappear."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於大眾中說是法時，無量眾生皆得大智聰叡辯才，攝受無量福德之聚，離諸憂惱，發喜樂心，善明眾論，登出離道，不復退轉，速證菩提。
translation: When the Bhagavān explained this teaching to the masses, measureless sentient beings attained great wisdom, intelligence, and eloquence, collected measureless accumulations of merit, became free of grief, arouse joy and happiness, and well understand the discussions of sentient beings, ascended the path of emancipation, never again retrogressed, and quickly realized enlightenment.

translation: Golden Light: The Most Excellent King Sutra, Volume 6
